source: Library of Congress Veterans History Project
description: Oral histories and collections from veterans of the 379th Bomb Group, preserved by the American Folklife Center at the Library of Congress.

veterans.name: Armand Joseph Volpini
veterans.summary: Lead bombardier who completed 30 missions with the 526th Bomb Squadron. Born to Italian immigrants in Massachusetts, Volpini trained as an Aviator Cadet before deploying to England on a B-17.

veterans.name: David Ellison Ferris
veterans.summary: Assigned to the 379th at Kimbolton in January 1944. His crew flew from Detroit to England via the North Atlantic, a journey taking six weeks due to engine troubles. Shot down and captured, he was held at Stalag Luft 1. Five of his crew members escaped through the Underground. At a 1980 POW reunion, he was recognized by his former radio operator.

veterans.name: Arlo F. Bartsch
veterans.contributor: Daughters of the American Revolution, Hot Springs Village, Arkansas Chapter
veterans.summary: First Lieutenant who served with the 525th Bomb Squadron at Kimbolton, England from 1942-1945.

veterans.name: John Carl Taylor
veterans.interviewer: Mary C. McCord, Adult Center of Prescott
veterans.summary: Rose to the rank of Lieutenant Colonel while serving with the 524th Bomb Squadron. His service extended beyond WWII to include the Pacific and Laos.

veterans.name: Roland H. Martin
veterans.shootdownDetails: Shot down by Lt. Ludwig Wirtz of Luftbeobachterstaffel 7 at 17:00 hrs, crash-landed south of Wurzburg, Germany during the second Schweinfurt raid.
veterans.summary: Pilot of 'The Iron Maiden' during the devastating second Schweinfurt raid where 60 American aircraft were lost. All crew members survived and became POWs. Martin was held at Stalag Luft 1 in Barth until liberation.

veterans.name: Elmo Fama
veterans.interviewer: Marilyn A. Pahr, Pacific Coast Air Museum
veterans.summary: Served as both waist gunner and radio operator on a B-17 bomber with the 526th Bomb Squadron during the Air Offensive Europe campaign.

veterans.name: Charles Wendell Parrish
locationsOfService: Stalag Luft IV, Gross Tychow, Pomerania
veterans.shootdownDetails: Crashed into the North Sea in July 1944 and was rescued by the British. Shot down over Aachen on August 9, 1944 and taken prisoner.
veterans.priorService: 31st Infantry Division (Dixie Division), Army National Guard
veterans.summary: B-17 gunner who survived two dramatic incidents: a crash into the North Sea in July 1944 (rescued by British forces) and being shot down over Aachen in August 1944. Spent the remainder of the war as a POW at Stalag Luft IV.

veterans.name: Alvar Bryce Platt
veterans.shootdownDetails: Shot down over the English Channel, captured, and held as a prisoner of war.
veterans.summary: B-17 waist gunner who was shot down over the English Channel. After capture, he was held as a POW at Stalag Luft XVII until liberation.
